Node.definition: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
literally: foot; hence: = a single instance in a range of repeated events
literally: foot; hence: = a single instance in a range of repeated events
literally: to meet; hence: = action by which humans are actively looking around for certain things to happen
= any action which attempts to interpret an event or a natural occurrence or a sign ► to predict an outcome or the will of a deity

literally: to set (one's) face (in a certain direction); hence: = action by which humans or deities fix their eyes in a certain direction, often with the purpose of going there or taking action against it
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
to lift up (one's eye, face); hence: = action by which humans direct their face or eyes away from the ground so that they can see what is in the distance or in the sky
= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= group of clans (מִשְׁפָּחָה) united by a common leader

= an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: to lift up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter certain words

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► father of Balaam (בִּלְעָם)
= a male human

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to receive as a vision|to have a vision
Node.definition: = process by which humans perceive something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

Node.gloss: to receive as a vision|to have a vision
Node.definition: = process by which humans perceive something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
= action by which humans assume a lying position, often in order to show respect, allegiance, or devotion

Node.gloss: to uncover (someone's) eyes > to open (someone's) eyes
Node.definition: literally: to uncover (someone's) eyes; hence: = causative action by which a deity enables a human being to see certain things, as that person's eyes had been covered before

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= state in which objects are of a high quality and/or a pleasure to look at
= construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= temporary construction ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, shepherds, etc.

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
literally: to stretch itself; hence: = state in which one of the boundaries of an area is as far as a certain location
= a fenced portion of land, ► used for growing flowers, plants, and vegetables, but also as burial place; ≈ associated with beauty and fragrance
= flowing body of water
= large tree which may reach a height of 36 m.; native to south east Asia and northern India; ◄ Aquilaria ahallocha (agarwood); ► known for its fragrant wood; ≈ associated with fragrance and beauty

= action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= evergreen tree growing up to 40 m tall, with a trunk up to 2.5 m in diameter; as it grows older its branches spread out more and more horizontally; grows in elevated places; ◄ Cedrus libani; ► highly appreciated building material; also used in cleaning ritual; ≈ associated with beauty, quality, pride, and strength
= open container ► used to carry water|= part of a tree which grows out from the trunk; ≈ found exclusively in contexts where the tree is used to symbolize a nation
= a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency

literally: to be, become high; hence: = processs by which humans or deities acquire an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= man
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to bring out|to take out|to carry out|to make (someone) leave|to make (someone) depart
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
exact meaning unsure; probably: = a wild, untamable animal with horns, and very strong; perhaps wild ox, buffalo, or rhinoceros; ≈ symbol of strength, wildness, and power
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
= any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength
= causative action by which humans or animals chew on an object persistently in an effort to satisfy their hunger or thirst

= pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment
exact meaning unsure, probably: = action by which humans hit objects with a hammer, club or similar object, resulting in breaking them into multiple pieces
= action by which humans or animals bend their knees, in order to lay down, give birth, have sex, or to be killed

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression and strength

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression, fearlessness, and respect

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same

= to consign someone or something to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, anger, or hostility, or because one was hired to do so

= to consign someone or something to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, anger, or hostility, or because one was hired to do so
= process by which the anger (אַף) of humans and deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= man; ◄ son of Zippor (צִפֹּור) ► king of Moab (מֹואָב) tried to curse and destroy the Israelites on their way to Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path
literally: to strike (one's) palms (together); hence: = action by which humans express their anger and disgust by striking their hands together

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to clap (one's) hands (out of anger, frustration, disgust)
Node.definition: exact meaning unsure, possibly: = to strike the palm of one's hand against the other hand ≈ as a symbol of anger, frustration, or disgust

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ son of Zippor (צִפֹּור) ► king of Moab (מֹואָב) tried to curse and destroy the Israelites on their way to Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path

= causative action by which humans or deities consign humans to death, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= state in which a countable entity is three in number
literally: foot; hence: = a single instance in a range of repeated events
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
= action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans, deities, or animals treat other humans, deities, times, or objects with honor and respect
= action by which humans, deities, or animals treat other humans, deities, times, or objects with honor and respect
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path
= man; ◄ son of Zippor (צִפֹּור) ► king of Moab (מֹואָב) tried to curse and destroy the Israelites on their way to Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= man; ◄ son of Zippor (צִפֹּור) ► king of Moab (מֹואָב) tried to curse and destroy the Israelites on their way to Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= a certain quantity that fill a certain container

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= an action by which humans and deities utter words, ◄ as coming from their mouths
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= particle linking two entities by which Y is added to X as an additional option
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= action by which humans or deities give information to others to help them exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= pertaining to being the last part of an event, close to its moment of completion
literally: end of days; hence: = a period of time in the future
literally: to lift up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter certain words

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► father of Balaam (בִּלְעָם)
= a male human

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: to know; hence: = process by which humans know what a certain experience is about by studying or living through it
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= an epithet for the God of Israel ◄ as the one who not only lives in the highest heavens but is also worthy of the highest honor

Node.definition: = process by which humans perceive something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
= action by which humans assume a lying position, often in order to show respect, allegiance, or devotion

Node.gloss: to uncover (someone's) eyes > to open (someone's) eyes
Node.definition: literally: to uncover (someone's) eyes; hence: = causative action by which a deity enables a human being to see certain things, as that person's eyes had been covered before

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
= process by which humans perceive, either with their physical eyes or in a vision

Node.gloss: to tread|to set foot (on something)|to march|to move
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals move forward by lifting and setting down each foot in turn

= celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
literally: staff; hence: = a person with the authority represented by a scepter

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which humans strike other humans or animals with a hammer, club or similar object, resulting in breaking the underlying bones
as [a] but used independently: = side of the head between forehead and ear; ► the hair of which was not be shaved as was the practice of certain ethnic groups
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)

Node.gloss: scalp|crown (of the head)|skull|to batter|to knock down|to beat down
Node.definition: = upper part of the head; ≈ sometimes used in conjunction with feet (רֶגֶל) to refer to the whole physical body|= causative action by which humans strike an object or person repeatedly with hard blows ► in order to destroy or kill it
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Adam (אָדָם) who was born after the death of Abel (הֶבֶל)
= nation; ◄ considered descendants of Esau (עֵשָׂו)
= an area that has become someone's possession, which often implies that this possession will be passed on to the next generation of the new owner
= an area that has become someone's possession, which often implies that this possession will be passed on to the next generation of the new owner

= Horite (חֹרִי) clan, named after the man who founded them and bearing the same name as the area they live in; they were later dispossessed by the Edomites (אֲדֹומִי) and it is not always clear from the context whether it refers to the original Horites (חֹרִי) or the Edomites (אֲדֹומִי)
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

literally: to do substantially; hence: = action as a result of which humans or deities are deemed worthy of respect, because of characteristics such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

= state in which a human being, animal, or deity is deemed worthy of respect because of characteristics such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

Node.gloss: to rule|to have charge|to have dominion
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities exercise authority over (other) humans, animals, and areas, often with focus on the manner in which this is done

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment
= a person who was able to flee from danger

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= ethnic group living a nomadic existence; ◄ regarded as decendants of Esau (עֵשָׂו) ► regarded as mortal enemies of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ultimately destroyed by Saul (שָׁאוּל)
literally: to lift up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter certain words

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which a group has a relatively high status

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= ethnic group living a nomadic existence; ◄ regarded as decendants of Esau (עֵשָׂו) ► regarded as mortal enemies of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ultimately destroyed by Saul (שָׁאוּל)
= pertaining to being the last part of an event, close to its moment of completion
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined|destruction|to be permanent
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention|= process of disappearing or being removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention|= process of having permanence through time

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= ethnic group; ◄ possibly descendants of Cain (קַיִן) ► ally of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) associated with Moses (מֹשֶׁה) father in law
literally: to lift up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter certain words

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state of not being subject to change
= location where a community, family, or household lives

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
= structure, made by birds ◄ from twigs, straw, grass, or other materials, ► to lay their eggs and shelter their young; ≈ associated with security
= set of particles marking an object or event as opposed to other objects and events

Node.gloss: to sweep away|to put away|to get rid of|to do away with|to remove|to clear out|to purge|to destroy
Node.definition: = action by which someone makes sure that a certain object is no longer found anywhere at all, ◄ as if it were completely consumed by fire
= ethnic group; ◄ possibly descendants of Cain (קַיִן) ► ally of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) associated with Moses (מֹשֶׁה) father in law
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= causative action by which people, animals or objects are forcibly carried off; ► in the case of people, into slavery or exile
literally: to lift up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter certain words

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
exclamation expressing grief and dismay

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to be alive|to become alive|to live
Node.definition: = to be alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= boat of a relatively large size; ► able to sail the sea and ocean
literally: hand; hence: = pertaining to the location to the left or right of an object ◄ analogous to the location of someone's hands or arms
= nation regarded as descendants of Javan (יָוָן) son of Japheth (יֶפֶת) possibly to be identified with Greece
literally: to bow down; hence: = causative action in which a humans or deities cause (other) humans to suffer hardship and trouble, ► resulting in a state of inability to help oneself
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
literally: to bow down; hence: = causative action in which a humans or deities cause (other) humans to suffer hardship and trouble, ► resulting in a state of inability to help oneself

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined|destruction|to be permanent
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention|= process of disappearing or being removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention|= process of having permanence through time
= man; ◄ son of Beor (בְּעֹור) from Pethor (פְּתֹור) ► a non Israelite prophet or fortune teller; ≈ the name became a symbol for attempts to deviate Israel from its divinely chosen path
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= man; ◄ son of Zippor (צִפֹּור) ► king of Moab (מֹואָב) tried to curse and destroy the Israelites on their way to Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
literally: road; hence: = action by which humans are travelling from one place to another
